materials.raw_text: Co: 12.5 g, Er: 50 g, Tb: 25 g, Te: 25 g

sourcing.instructions: Co: Purchase from a chemical supplier or online platform specializing in metal powders. Er: Obtain from a rare earth metal supplier. Tb: Available from specialty metal suppliers. Te: Obtain from a chemical supplier or online.
steps: Co: Purchase from a chemical supplier or online platform specializing in metal powders. Er: Obtain from a rare earth metal supplier. Tb: Available from specialty metal suppliers. Te: Obtain from a chemical supplier or online.

1. Weigh 12.5 g of Cobalt (Co) powder using a digital scale. 2. Weigh 50 g of Erbium (Er) powder. 3. Weigh 25 g of Terbium (Tb) powder. 4. Weigh 25 g of Tellurium (Te) powder. 5. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine all the weighed powders thoroughly using a spatula or mechanical mixer to ensure homogeneity.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh 12.5 g of Cobalt (Co) powder using a digital scale. 2. Weigh 50 g of Erbium (Er) powder. 3. Weigh 25 g of Terbium (Tb) powder. 4. Weigh 25 g of Tellurium (Te) powder. 5. In a clean, dry mixing container, combine all the weighed powders thoroughly using a spatula or mechanical mixer to ensure homogeneity.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a crucible suitable for high-temperature applications. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat the mixture to 1000°C at a rate of 10°C per minute. 4. Hold the temperature at 1000°C for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and homogenization.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a crucible suitable for high-temperature applications. 2. Place the crucible in a furnace. 3. Heat the mixture to 1000°C at a rate of 10°C per minute. 4. Hold the temperature at 1000°C for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and homogenization.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool down to room temperature naturally (approximately 6-8 hours). Do not force cool to prevent cracking.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow the crucible to cool down to room temperature naturally (approximately 6-8 hours). Do not force cool to prevent cracking.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample into the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges to smooth out any rough surfaces. 4. Optionally, seal the surface with a protective coating to enhance durability.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond saw to cut the sample into the desired dimensions of 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 3. Sand the edges to smooth out any rough surfaces. 4. Optionally, seal the surface with a protective coating to enhance durability.
